meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be remedied or corrected.
meanings.sent1: The remediability of the situation gave us hope for a solution.
meanings.sent2: The remediability of the error allowed for a quick fix.
meanings.sent3: With such high remediability, it felt like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problems had a remarkable remediability, like a magic wand.
meanings.sent5: The remediability of the issue was like a beacon of light in the darkness of confusion.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be fixed or resolved.
meanings.sent1: We assessed the remediability of the damage before starting repairs.
meanings.sent2: The remediability of the leak determined the urgency of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The remediability of the broken toy made it a challenge worth tackling.
meanings.sent4: His determination to improve showed a high level of remediability in his character.
meanings.sent5: The remediability of the conflict was a testament to their willingness to find a solution.
